meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the Bible.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifacts discovered were prebiblical, dating back to a time long before the Bible.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study prebiblical civilizations to understand the history of humanity before the Bible.
meanings.sent3: The prebiblical stories passed down through generations were filled with mystery and wonder.
meanings.sent4: The prebiblical era whispered secrets of a world untouched by the words of the Bible.
meanings.sent5: In the prebiblical landscape, myths and legends intertwined with reality in captivating ways.

meanings.definition: Relating to the time period before the Bible was written.
meanings.sent1: The prebiblical scrolls contained wisdom from a time before the Bible existed.
meanings.sent2: Historians explore prebiblical cultures to uncover the roots of ancient traditions.
meanings.sent3: Children listened in awe as their elders recounted prebiblical tales of bravery and magic.
meanings.sent4: The prebiblical era stood as a silent witness to the dawn of human storytelling.
meanings.sent5: Legends of the prebiblical world danced on the edges of imagination, waiting to be discovered.
